direction.raw_text: Blue Revised:       09/17/97 Pink Revised:       11/11/97 Green Revised:      12/15/97 Goldenrod Revised:  12/16/97 Buff Revised:       03/17/98 Salmon Revised:     03/23/98 BLACK We hear TRAFFIC, some STREET NOISES, then... FADE IN: A MIAMI STREET - DAY The financial district.  Lots of people in suits.  A shaky, spasmodic ZOOM IN finds... JACK FOLEY -- forty, big, focused expression -- as he rips a tie from around his neck and throws it down in the gutter.  He starts across the street, now peeling off his suitcoat and dropping that, too, right there on the asphalt as we then... WHIP PAN OVER TO REVEAL: A BANK ACROSS THE STREET As Foley goes inside, we then... CUT TO: A PRINTED BROCHURE THAT READS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We then PULL BACK TO REVEAL that we're now... INSIDE THE BANK as Foley stands at a counter holding the above CREDIT APPLICATION while he studies the bank layout. Foley watches a MAN IN A SUIT, carrying an attache-case, enter the bank and move through the gate into the fenced-off business area at the front.  An EXECUTIVE rises from his desk, shakes hands with the man and they both sit down. Foley rosses the brochure in the trash, then crosses to a teller window where a nameplate on the counter tells us the young woman with the pile of dark hair smiling at him is LORETTA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I help you, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loretta, you see that guy talking to your manager, has his case open? Foley takes out a ZIPPO LIGHTER and casually, yet expertly, begins to fiddle with it as the teller looks across the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Mr. Guindon, one of our assistant managers.  Our manager is Mr. Schoen, but he's not in today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you see the guy with the attache case?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my partner.  He has a gun in there.  And if you don't do exactly what I tell you, or you give me any kind of a problem, I'll look over at my partner and he'll shoot your Mr. Guindon between the eyes. Loretta goes stiff, swallows, stares back at Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now take one of those big envelopes and put as many hundreds, fifties and twenties as you can pack into it. Nothing with bank straps or rubber bands.  I don't want any dye packs.  I don't want any bait money.  Start with the second drawer and then the one over there, under the computer.  Come on, Loretta, the key's right there next to you.  No bills off the bottom of the drawer. (as she works) First time being robbed? (she nods) You're doing great.  Just smile, Loretta, so you won't look like you're being held up. (she smiles awkwardly) That's the way, you're doing fine. We hear a bit of thunder and Foley cuts a fast look out the front door.  When he turns back, he sees that Loretta's having some trouble fitting all the bills into the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, give me the twenties.  I'll put 'em in my pocket.  Okay, I haven't had to give my partner a sign; that's good. Now, he's gonna wait thirty seconds till after I'm out the door, make sure you haven't set off the alarm.  If you have, he's gonna shoot Mr. Guindon between the eyes.  Okay?  I think that'll do it.  Thank you, Loretta, and have a nice day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, too. Foley heads for the door.  He pauses by Mr. Guindon's desk, looks back at Loretta.  Foley smiles at her, then turns to the Man sitting with Mr. Guindon, indicates Loretta...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's cute, isn't she? The man looks across the bank at Loretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah, I guess so. Foley winks at Loretta and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that? EXT. BANK - SAME As Foley comes out, he calmly walks to a Honda Civic and gets in. INT. CAR - SAME As Foley tries to start the car.  No go.  He tries again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... But the car won't start.  Foley bangs on the wheel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck! Foley then stiffens as a cop sticks his gun through the open window into Foley's ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you flooded it. Foley looks to the passenger window, where ANOTER COP, smiling, now has his gun pointing at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out've the car, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna hear a funny story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up and get out've the car. And as Foley obliges, we then... FADE TO WHITE. We hear a MAN GRUNT.  Then see Foley in SLOW MOTION as he jumps through frame, now we see a basketball come up in his hand as we realize he's on his way to the rim when... ...ANOTHER GUY rams into him in mid-air, knocks him down. EXT. PRISON YARD - DAY A BASKETBALL GAME in progress.  All of the men, Foley included, are dressed in blue coveralls and white T-shirts.  The game is rough.  Hair is pulled.  Eyes are poked.  Faces punched. A title reads: "GLADES CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION.  BELLE GLADE, FLORIDA." Foley is the oldest player here.  He's getting tired, starts to lose his breath.  He finally walks off the court, breathing so hard he can't even talk.  He simply motions to SOME YOUNG CONVICT to come in and take his place. Foley sits down on a bench, tries to catch his breath.  He looks across the yard to where... A GROUP OF ELDERLY INMATES sitting around a wooden picnic table are playing cards.  All of them are over sixty.  One of them, a one-legged guy on crutches hops away from the table, spits out some tobacco as we... INTERCUT THE OLD TIMERS WITH FOLEY WATCHING THEM: As we see one old guy is making a picture frame out of old Pal Mal and Lucky Strike packs.  Another tends to a tomato bush in a tiny patch of garden near the wall.  Another one sits nearby painting a picture of a man and a boy fishing from a rowboat. Foley is about to get up off the bench when something catches his eye.  He watches as... TWO LATINO MEN both little guys, jog past the game, slow to a walk, then stop and begin stretching out.  One of them nods to Foley.  Foley nods back, waits for the Latin guys to walk off, then walks over to a guard, PUPKO ("PUP"), heavy-set, dumb as dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want something, Foley? Foley keeps his eyes fixed on the basketball game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people are going out of here. What if I told you where and when?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect you to look out for me, Pup, let me run off work details.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  How many going out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do, but I won't tell you just yet. Meet me in the chapel at eight-thirty, right before lock-down. INT. MESS HALL - LUNCH As Foley takes his tray up the centre aisle, he scans the sea of white T-shirts until he sees the two little Latins sitting at a table full of other little Latins.  CHINO -- fifties, in shape -- shovels macaroni in his mouth. Chino's "wife", LULU, nineteen, looks up from his own neat tray of macaroni and jello and watches Foley walk past and sit down with a bunch of bikers. Foley watches as the guy across from Chino scrapes some macaroni off his plate and on to Chino's and Chino wolfs that down, too. EXT. MESS - DAY Chino steps outside and lights a cigarette.  He puts an arm around Lulu, starts to walk off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today's the day, huh? Chino looks over, watches Foley approach, lets his arm slip down so he can hook his thumb into Lulu's belt... the next thing to having him on a leash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You excited?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, man, Super Bowl Sunday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but I see you moved it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you think is today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were out running this morning, sticking to your routine, anybody happened to notice.  But you only did a couple of miles instead of your usual five.  Saving yourself for the main event.  Then I see you inside eating ten pounds of macaroni. Carbohydrates for endurance. Chino and Lulu exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want, I tole you you can come. You all right, Foley.  I like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me I can come 'cause I caught you digging the fuckin' tunnel, saw you and Lulu coming out of the bushes, thought maybe you two were making out. Foley smiles at Lulu, who glares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what, you finish ahead of schedule? Chino looks towards the fence along the front of the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see what they doing, those posts out there?  Putting up another fence, five metres on the other side of the one that's there.  We wait until Super Bowl Sunday, they could have the second fence built and we have to dig another nine, ten days.  So we going soon as it's dark.  You want -- I mean it -- you can still come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate the offer.  And it's tempting. Foley looks off towards the visitors' parking area, the fence not twenty yards away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, man, it's a long run to civilization.  A hundred miles to Miami? I'm too old to start acting crazy, try a stunt like that.  You make it out, send me a postcard. CUT TO: A NOTEPAD where we see someone has written "IT'S MAGIC!" then crossed out the "IT'S" and replaced it with the word "LIKE".  We hear THE PHONE RING AND... REVEAL: INT. ADELE'S APARTMENT - DAY Miami Beach Moderne.  ADELE -- mid-thirties, pretty, Foley's ex -- sits at her kitchen table writing on a pad.  She grabs the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? (then, sighs) Yeah, I accept. INT. PRISON HALLWAY - DAY Foley on the phone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Adele, how you doing? INTERCUTTING FOLEY & ADELE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Bank Robber, want some advice? Next time, leave the engine running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's funny, Adele.  How many more times you gonna gimme that one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Till it's not funny any more.  What do you want, Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that Super Bowl party?  They changed the date.  It's on tonight , eight-thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you tell me one-time calls aren't monitored?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said not as a rule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why don't you come right out and tell me what you're talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to Miss Smarty Mouth.  Out there in the free world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's free about it?  I'm looking for work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to Mandrake the Magician?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emil the Amazing.  The bastard fired me and hired another girl, a redhead. I'm working on a new business card, pass out to the cafes.  How's this sound--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Adele, the reason I called, that party is today instead of Sunday. About eight-thirty, like only a few hours from now.  So you'll have to get hold of Buddy, whatever he might be doing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the one driving the other car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, seeing as you have so much luck with cars, Buddy thought it might be better to bring two.  He got this guy he says you know from Lompoc, Glenn something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glenn Michaels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's him.  Buddy says Glenn thinks you guys are real cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did, huh.  Well, tell Buddy I see Glenn wearing his sunglasses I'll step on 'em.  I might not even take 'em off first. INT. RESTAURANT - DAY As MARSHALL SISCO -- fifty -- slides a small wrapped box across a table...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy birthday. ...to where KAREN SISCO -- twenty-eight, black suit, long hair, a knockout -- sits.  She picks up the box and shakes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fit another Chanel suit in here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something better.  Open it. Karen starts to carefully unwrap the present.  Marshall watches, takes a sip of his drink, looks around the bar, sees how everyone's looking at the two of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God... She pulls a gleaming automatic pistol from the box...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a -- KAREN --Sig-Sauer .38.  I love it. She leans across the table and kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy birthday, kid. (then) You want another Coke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't.  I gotta drive out to Glades, then I'm meeting Ray Nicolet at ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one is that?  The ATF guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was.  Ray's with the F.B.I. now, he switched over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still married though, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Technically.  They're separated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he's moved out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's about to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then they're not separated, are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we change the subject?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing at Glades?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serving process, a Summons and Complaint.  Some con doing mandatory life doesn't like macaroni and cheese. He files suit, says he has no choice in what they serve and it violates his civil rights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know you can always step in, work with me full-time as one of my investigators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You used to like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd meet doctors, lawyers -- nothing wrong with them necessarily if they're divorced.  Why settle for some cowboy cop who drinks too much and cheats on his wife?  That's the way those hotshots are, all of 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really gotta go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't get to talk much any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout I come next Sunday and watch the Super Bowl with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like that. She gets up, kisses him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the gun, Dad. INT. FOLEY'S CELL - BELLE GLADE - DAY Foley comes in, lies down on the bunk.  He looks about the cell.  All he's got to show for himself.  It's now quiet on the cellblock.  Foley closes his eyes and we... CUT TO: EXT. PRISON AUDITORIUM A few hundred cons scream encouragement/insults as MAURICE "SNOOPY" MILLER, a lanky, scary, mean-looking black man in boxing trunks, hits a white guy with a ferocious hook. Title reads: LOMPOC FEDERAL PENITENTIARY.  LOMPOC, CALIFORNIA. And then... TWO YEARS AGO . AT THE BACK OF THE AUDITORIUM Foley leans in a doorway watching with BUDDY BRAGG -- black, Foley's age, shaved head. The BELL SOUNDS and the white guy staggers to his corner, as does Maurice.  GLENN MICHAELS -- surfer look, dark shades -- counts cash in Maurice's corner, whispers something into the fighter's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ref don't call it pretty soon, Snoopy's gonna send this guy out in a body bag. Foley watches a MAN -- fifties, out of place, not as hard-looking as those around him.  The guy looks nervous, can feel the other cons' eyes on him as he tries to find a seat. The BELL SOUNDS and the white boxer staggers to his feet. Maurice steps in and resumes the bloody pummelling.  Foley turns and watches the fight now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone ever tell you why they call him Snoopy? Buddy shakes his head.  Maurice dances around the other guy now.  Teases him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was Maurice "Mad Dog" Miller back when he was pro.  Now you pet him, he goes down. The white guy throws a tired, loping roundhouse that barely glances off Maurice's jaw.  Sure enough, Maurice makes a big show out of snapping his head back, staggering, before he finally goes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it. Foley watches the new inmate as fights erupt all around him and, anxious now, he tries to get out of there. EXT. PRISON YARD - DAY Foley and Buddy sit atop a cement picnic table watching as nearby, the "winning" BOXER -- still wearing last night's pummelling on his face -- gloats to a group of cons.  He throws a fake punch at one of them as he demonstrates his winning technique...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy's braggin' he won a thrown fight. Fuckin' pathetic. Foley looks at the other side of the yard where Maurice now stands at the far side of the yard coldly watching the guy, one hand thrust into his pocket.  Foley watches as Maurice stops the NEW INMATE -- the older guy who looked out of place at the fights -- as he comes out into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Richard Ripley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Wall Street guy?  Oh, yeah.  I didn't recognize him without his rug. Foley watches as Maurice talks to the new inmate, the guy nodding, acquiescent, respectful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick the Ripper they called him, on account of all the people he ripped off. Foley watches as Ripley now makes a note in a BLACK BOOK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doin' here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three years. They look to where Glenn Michaels, the blond guy in dark shades we saw in Maurice's corner, works out on the bench press a few feet away.  He's shirtless, tan, in shape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got three years and fined fifty million dollars and wrote 'em a fucking check.  Like that, fifty mil, signed his name. (struggles with the bar) Whoa-- little help here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you talkin' to, Studs?  Me, or Buddy.  I can't tell, you got those shades on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys-- come on-- this is too heavy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess the bright glare out here made it hard to see the numbers on the weights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take the shades off.  Just get this fuckin' thing off me. Foley helps him get the bar up.  Glenn sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know he wrote a check?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me.  He works the laundry with me.  The guy loves to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, to the U.S. Attorney.  I hear he rolled over on all the snitches he was doing business with and got 'em all brought up. He watches Snoopy talking to Ripley, one eye always on the swaggering boxer across the yard, one hand in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, anybody that can write a check for fifty mil, he says any thing I'm all fucking ears.  Like the other day, he tells me how he's got all this money in foreign banks, plus around five mil in uncut diamonds at his house.  He said, quote, "Where I can put my hands on it anytime."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool.  Where's the guy live? Foley watches a few more of Maurice's friends surround Ripley. Again, Ripley takes out his black book, starts nodding, making notations...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Detroit.  Snoopy Miller told me uncut diamonds are as easy to move as cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever seen an uncut diamond, Studs? They look like plain old rocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So.  What's your point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My point is, that's probably what you're gonna end up with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he's lying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use your head.  The guys got five million lying around his house, you really think he's gonna tell some motormouth he just met in prison about it? A BELL SOUNDS.  Everyone starts walking for the gate. Foley watches as the Boxer and his crew head for the gate, Maurice still standing there with his hand in his pocket. SLOW MOTION AS the boxer gets to the gate, sees Maurice who moves to him now, smiling like he's so glad to see him... his left hand clapping the guy on the back, saying something like congratulations as now his right hand comes out of his pocket and we see the long metal shiv--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here it comes. Maurice wraps his left arm around the boxer's shoulder and hugs him tight for a moment, then quickly moves away.  The Boxer stands there like a statue, doesn't move until he's at last jostled from behind and his legs fold and he drops to the cement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess the Snoop doesn't like to lose, even if it's on purpose. We hear a WHISTLE BLOW as a GUARD spots the body.  And now everyone moves like hell for the gate... except for... Richard Ripley who stands there frozen, staring down at the body. Foley glances back at the approaching guards, casually takes Ripley by the arm as he passes, leads him away from there, talks to him as they walk into the block...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't wanna be standing there, the hacks start asking questions you don't wanna answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, uh, right, thanks... Foley then moves away.  He sees Maurice looking back at him, giving him a hard stare just before he melts into the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. FOLEY'S CELL - BELLE GLADE - DAY (NOW) He lies there another moment when... A PAIROF LEGS swings down over the side from the top bunk. Foley's CELLMATE jumps down, walks the three feet or so to the toilet, casually pulls down his pants and starts to go to the bathroom.  Foley shakes his head and turns away... EXT. STRIP MALL - DAY As Buddy walks up to a Cadillac Sedan DeVille Concours pulling a slim-jim from the back of his pants, about to jimmy the door, when he sees... A WOMAN -- middle-aged, wearing pearls and high heels -- come out of the Winn Dixie pushing a grocery cart full of groceries. Buddy sticks the jimmy back in his pants, waits until the woman is opening her trunk before coming forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, lemme help you with those, ma'am. She doesn't seem too sure about it, but lets him load the groceries in the trunk and take the key out of the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ask for your help, so don't expect a tip. Buddy smiles, waves her off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, ma'am.  I'll just take your car. She stands there stupidly as he gets in and drives off. INT. CHAPEL - DUSK In the midst of a remodel.  As door opens and Pup comes in. Foley puts a finger to his lips...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're right underneath you, Pup. They dug a tunnel. Foley watches Pup creep up the aisle towards the front of the chapel, eyes on the floor, listening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't hear 'em.  Where's the tunnel come out? Pup turns his back, walks up the aisle and across the front of the pews to a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second fence post from the tower out there.  Go on, take a look. As Pup stares out the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see nothing there. Foley reaches down into a pew where's stashed a FOUR-FOOT CRUCIFIX.  He picks it up, starts up the aisle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will directly.  Keep watching. INT. KAREN SISCO'S CAR - DUSK As the high beams from her car show the prison parking area, then the fence strung with razor wire.  Karen parks near the fence, lights a cigarette and dials her car phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.  Karen Sisco again for Ray Nicolet. (beat) He's not?  Could you tell him that... never mind.  I'll call back. Headlights hit Karen's rear-view mirror, a car pulling in behind her.  The lights go off, then come on again.  She adjusts the mirror to deflect the glare. INT. THE CAR BEHIND HER - DUSK As Buddy sits watching the cons come in from the athletic field. He sees the mirror flash in the car in front of him as Karen checks her face out in the rear-view. INT. CHAPEL - DUSK As Foley moves up behind Pup, he lets his jacket fall to the floor, holds the crucifix down against his leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There some car headlights out there... (then) Jesus Christ... Now he pulls his radio from his belt, says into it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man outside the fence!  By tower six! (responds to radio) This is Officer Pupko... (then) I'm looking at him, for Christ's sake! Okay-- now Foley raises the metal cross, steps in and lays it smack against the side of Pup's head.  Drops him clean with one swing, bouncing him off the window frame and down without a sound coming from him. INT. KAREN SISCO'S CAR - NIGHT As Karen grabs the court papers off the seat, opens her car door, glances at the fence and pauses as she sees A FIGURE there, crouching down. Karen turns on her headlights.  No, not crouched.  The guy is coming out of the ground .  On this side of the fence. Head and shoulders appear and another guy comes out of the ground.  Right in front of her. Karen leans on the horn, holds it down and sees the two guys by the fence -- Chino and Lulu -- look into her headlights, poised there for a moment before taking off into the dark.  Karen gets out of the car... INT. BUDDY'S CAR - SAME As Buddy watches a spotlight from the tower come on and follow the two cons as we then hear the sound of RIFLE REPORTS before the men disappear into the dark. Then Buddy sees Karen in his headlights, whistles softly as he gets a good look at her long legs as she raises the lid to her trunk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's she doing? He watches her duck her head in the trunk and come out with a holstered pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh. But then she throws the pistol in the trunk, ducks in there again and comes out this time racking a shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your hands in the air! Buddy watches the two cons, both Latins, make up their minds, start edging away -- shit, they've come this far. They look out at the spotlight sweeping around in the dark, then look the other way, along the fence towards the main gate, to see armed hacks coming out on the run, and that decides it for the cons.  They take off running... Now Buddy watches as Karen puts her pump gun on them, but doesn't fire... The hacks running from the gate with rifles beat her to it, open up all at once and keep firing until the two convicts are cut down as they run. The hacks glance at Karen, but don't bother with her, more interested in the hole the convicts had come out of.  Now they're standing by it peering in, edging closer with their weapons ready, then they all step back at once, bump into each other as... direction.raw_text: I don't smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard the man.  Go on outta here. Foley doesn't move, just gives the guy a bored once over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Himey here's a pro-toh-jay of mine. He's ranked number thirty-two in the federal prison system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-two outta what, twenty? Himey bulldozes forward, pulling his massive fist back to clock Foley in the head when... ...in one swift motion Foley brings his book up in one hand, like he's throwing a pie, and drives the hefty repair manual into Himey's face, snapping the big guy's head back, sending his feet flying out from under him so that he hits the floor back-first with a loud thud. Maurice goes for Foley who picks up the chair just as we hear A WHISTLE.  They all freeze, look to... A PRISONER AT ANOTHER TABLE Who nods towards the door.  We PAN OVER just as A GUARD APPEARS, takes in the scene as a dazed Himey slowly pulls himself up, covers his now bleeding nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you know, reading's funnamental an' shit, we just excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear outta here. The guard exits.  Maurice and Foley are still staring at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.  Snoopy?  Did we settle the fish thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Sure.  It's all settled. He pours the water out of the bag and drops the fish into Ripley's open hand.  Maurice then squeezes Ripley's hand into a fist, crushing the fish.  He taps his fist to Ripley's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how you do it. Maurice gives Foley a last look, starts out of the room with Himey.  Ripley looks at the crushed fish in his hand, then at Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for your help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any time. We hear a PHONE RING and then... CUT TO: MAURICE MILLER'S HOUSE - THE BEDROOM - (NOW) As Maurice lies in bed watching a boxing match on television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick and jab, fool.  Stick and jab. A frisbee whizzes past the television .  We hear A DOG YELP OS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Watch that shit! Maurice's girlfriend MOSELLE - about thirty, sleepy-eyed, in a green bathrobe - picks the frisbee up off the floor as THE PHONE RINGS AWAY on the bedside table right next to Maurice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tuffy.  C'mere, boy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna answer the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?  It's not for me. Maurice watches as Moselle now tries to throw the frisbee to a little wire-haired terrier, but it just bounces off the dog's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moselle, the fuck are you doing to my little Tuffy? He lovingly nuzzles the dog like it's his child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trainin' Tuffy, so he can be on a Kal Kan commercial, make us some extra money. He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the dumbest thing I heard in my life.  Everybody knows Kal Kan doesn't pay for shit.  You gonna get a gig, it's gotta be for one of the big three: Science Diet, Iams or that Cycle shit for the fat dogs.  Now answer the fuckin phone. She comes over, picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? (hands it to Maurice) For you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is me. EXT. PHONE BOOTH - GAS STATION - NIGHT An antsy Glenn with his shades on talks on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snoopy.  Glenn Michaels. INTERCUTTING GLENN & MAURICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Studs.  Hey, son, you must be one a them psychic friends.  I was just thinkin' about you. Glenn watches as some guy in a suit gets out of a black Lincoln Town Car and jogs to the john.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Snoopy, I'm on my way up to Detroit and need a place to crash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You crazy, come up here ?  It's fuckin one degree outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna talk to you about a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't really go into it right now. I'll just tell you it's someone big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some one ?  Gimme a hint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a guy you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme another hint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Richard Ripley. Maurice doesn't say a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm here, all right.  I'm very here. Question is, why aren't you here? EXT. BUDDY'S APARTMENT - SOMEWHERE IN FLORIDA - NIGHT As Foley and Buddy hurry up the front steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying she wasn't scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause she had her hand on her gun the whole time, waiting to make her move. Buddy opens the door, looks at Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just jealous it was me in the trunk with her and not you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. INT. BUDDY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT A "hideout."  Not much in the way of furnishings.  Foley follows Buddy inside, watches as he bolts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First thing I'm gonna do is get all this mud off me. Foley starts for the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been dreaming about a hot bath for the last six months.  Soak the prison off me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's some lilac oil, you want some, a vanilla candle under the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something about a nice hot bath, transforms a person.  It's not just about opening up your pores, know what I mean?  There's just something about the heat and the wet that's calming you know?  Settles me in a way that I really can't articulate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know exactly what you mean.  It's just a feeling. (beat) You know, I could go for some wine tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a store around the corner, I'll be right back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds great. Foley goes into the bathroom.  A moment later WE HEAR THE BATH RUNNING. INT. APARTMENT HALLWAY - DAY As Buddy leaves the apartment, starts down the hall, KAREN STEPS INTO FRAME, watches as he disappears down the stairs.  Gun drawn, she then moves towards the apartment. INT. BATHROOM - DAY As Foley undresses, picks up a candle off the sink and smells it.  He notices his nude image in the mirror and checks himself out. INT. APARTMENT - DAY As Karen slips the door.  She looks around, HEARS THE WATER RUNNING. She racks the slide on her gun, snicks off the safety and starts for the bathroom.  Suddenly, the water is turned off.  She stops where she is.  She then moves a careful step at a time towards the open doorway. Gradually the tub comes into view, beginning with Foley's feet resting crossed on the other end, then the middle of the tub, then she's in the doorway, looking down at... Foley, lying there in the tub, his eyes closed.  Karen cuts her eyes down the length of him, taking a moment here to check him out, long enough for Foley to open his eyes and grab her hand, the one holding the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. They look at each other a moment.  He then pulls her down to him and kisses her.  She kisses him back.  He then pulls her into the tub with him as we now hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karen...? CUT TO: KAREN As she opens her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? REVEAL: A HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY Flowers everywhere.  Karen -- bruises on her face -- lies in bed.  Her father, Marshall, sits on the chair beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were talking in your sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd I say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Hey, yourself."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. We hear A KNOCK at the door.  They look to where Special Agent DANIEL BURDON -- black, forties, expensive suit -- stands in the doorway, file in one hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Daniel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel Burdon, FBI.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall Sisco.  Karen's dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mind please waiting outside.  We have some business to do here. Marshall looks at him a moment.  Then, to Karen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to go to the john anyway. Burdon waits for Marshall to walk out, then sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna be on the task force, Daniel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice of you to offer, Karen, but I got all the help I can use right now.  Instead, let's talk about how you got the bump on your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that my report you're holding onto?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but I want to hear you tell it. Starting with when you tried to grab the wheel -- where was this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming to the Okeechobee exit... And now we see it... INSIDE THE CAR Going over a hundred miles per hour, blowing past cars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the next exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to do now ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glenn, take the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way, man, no fuckin' way am I gonna turn myself in. She reaches over and grabs the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fuck are you doing?! He hits the brakes.  The car goes off the road, down the grade, the abutment coming right at us as we go back to... THE HOSPITAL ROOM As Burdon sets the file down, sits back now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next thing I knew, the paramedics were taking me out the car. Burdon looks at Karen a moment, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a couple of points I keep wondering about have to do with the two guys that grabbed you.  Buddy is it?  And this fella Jack Foley.  I swear the man must've robbed two hundred banks in his time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?  Huh.  He told me he didn't remember how many he robbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talked to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the trunk, yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... different things, prison, movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fella holds you hostage, you talk about movies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an unusual experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foley made me think of that fella Carl Tillman, the one you were seeing, it turns out the same time he was doing banks.  You recall that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was seeing Carl Tillman, I didn't know he robbed banks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but I had enough reason to believe he did, and I told you.  So you had to at least suspect him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what happened to Carl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The time came, you shot him.  But you didn't shoot Foley or the guy with him.  They're unarmed, you had a shotgun and you let them throw you in the trunk. Okay, now you got your Sig in your hand.  You say in the report you couldn't turn around, he had you pinned down.  But when the trunk opened, how come you didn't cap the two guys then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what you would've done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say in the report Glenn didn't have a gun, but you let him get away, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel, what do you work on most of the time, fraud?  Go after crooked bookkeepers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karen, I've been with the Bureau fifteen years, on all kinds of investigations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever shot a man?  How many times have you been primary through the door?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to qualify, is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to know what you're talking about. We hear CHUCKLING OS.  Burdon glances at the doorway where we see Marshall now standing, enjoying this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll talk another time, Karen.  All right?  I'd like to know why Foley put you in that second car when he didn't need you any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to ask him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds to me like he liked having you around.  I'll see you, Karen.  Mr. Sisco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Burdon. Marshall waits for him to walk out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The white man's Burdon.  That's what everybody calls him in Miami.  The Metro-Dade guys.  He's got a knack for pissing people off. She's not listening.  He sits down, takes her hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you thinking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sig Sauer you got me for my birthday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell you what, you're a good girl, you might get another one for Christmas. She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get it back when I get Foley. EXT. BUDDY'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY A dozen GERIATRIC RESIDENTS sit on chairs out front as Buddy climbs the steps carrying a bag of groceries under one arm, newspaper under the other.  An old woman comes out the door as Buddy opens it and squints at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh--  Are you delivering the oxygen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, no, ma'am.  Sorry. INT. BUDDY'S APARTMENT - DAY Buddy's REAL apartment, not the one Karen pictured in her dream. This one's nicer, with a view of the beach.  Jack stands on the balcony going through KAREN'S PURSE. He pulls out her wallet, checks out her driver's licence photo. He does the same with her gym I.D. card.  He finds her address book and opens it up.  A photo of her father slips out.  Jack examines it a moment, then flips through the book. He stares at something in her bag a moment, then reaches in and comes up with her us Marshal I.D.  He slips it open and studies the badge and the picture opposite. He holds on to it, looks out at the ocean, but really sees... THE OPEN TRUNK OF THE CAR - LAST NIGHT As Karen gets out, saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You win, Jack. BACK IN THE APARTMENT Foley turns away from the view as Buddy walks in, sets the grocery bag down on the coffee table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made the front page. He holds up the newspaper so that Foley can see his picture on the front page: an unflattering mug shot that doesn't look all that much like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pass this picture around you can go anywhere you want, nobody'll know you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't feeling my best that day. I'd just drawn thirty to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe this'll make you feel better. Buddy reaches into the bag, tosses Foley a NEW ZIPPO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Foley catches the lighter, immediately begins playing with it. He looks at the paper on the coffee table as Buddy sits down, pulls some groceries and a sixpack from the bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paper says there's ten grand each on you, Chino and Lulu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say anything in there about Karen Sisco?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just that she got away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but what happened after she drove off with Glenn?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to ask Glenn.  And most likely, he's on his way to Detroit, where we should be. Foley walks back out on to the balcony, looks at the contents of Karen's bag spread out on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You realize what you're doing?  Worrying about a person that works in law enforcement.  You want to sit down and have cocktails with a girl that tried to shoot you.  You hear what I'm saying? Foley holds up the picture of Marshall Sisco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think this old guy is her boyfriend? It's the only picture she carries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I going to Detroit by myself? Foley picks up her drivers licence photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Longer we hang around down here, Jack, better chance there is either Glenn's gonna fuck up the whole score, or we gonna get busted, or both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll leave first thing in the morning. EXT. MARSHALL SISCO'S CONDO - DAY Right on a marina.  Boats bobbing on the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this Foley? INT. MARSHALL SISCO'S CONDO - DAY Marshall sits in his chair holding up a newspaper as Karen hands him a drink.  She stares at the photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't even look like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he looks a lot... She realizes Marshall's watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Different. The doorbell RINGS.  She ignores his look, gets up.  Walks to the door and opens it to reveal RAY NICOLET, boots, leather jacket, etc.  Cowboy Cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Ray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look great.  Your dad taking good care of you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He took the week off so we'd have time together.  So far he's worked on his boat every day.  Dad?  Ray Nicolet. Marshall gets up, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard a lot about you, Mr. Sisco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Likewise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray's with the F.B.I. Task Force, working on the prison break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see that. Ray turns to Karen, holding his jacket open to show the task force inscription on his T-shirt in red, the guy's .357 tucked into his waistband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case no one knows what he does. Tell me, Ray, you ever wear one says, "Undercover"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.  We got one of 'em. Karen looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it Foley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off a tip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, someone spotted two of 'em in this hobo camp out by the airport, called the number--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it, soon as I saw they were offering a reward. She grabs Nicolet by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foley?  Oh.  No, it was one of the Cubans.  Linares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went out there, full SWAT, two choppers, the whole bit, but Linares started shooting anyway.  We put him down, but somehow Chirino got away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you pay the guy the reward?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, as soon as we got back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foley hadn't been there? Her father gives her a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place was strictly Cuban.  If Foley had a ride he must have his own agenda. He seems to be the only one knows what he's doing. THE PHONE RINGS.  Marshall moves to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? (beat) Yeah, she is.  Just a minute. (hands her the phone) For you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? CUT TO: FOLEY ON THE PHONE - DAY On the balcony.  Flipping through a copy of Vogue while Buddy watches television inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. INTERCUTTING KAREN & FOLEY - DAY Karen just stands there, sees her father looking at her as Ray drones on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She walks out to her father's balcony now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to see if you're okay, make sure Glenn didn't hurt you or, you know, anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something I've been wondering, Ray... Marshall picks up the newspaper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says in the headline, "I slept with a murderer, says shaken Miami woman." She lives in Little Havana, her husband's out of town working when one of the escapees shows up at her door... She closes the glass door, so that they won't hear her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get this number?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was it answered the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of your business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just worried maybe I'm not old enough for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really.  He has a cop's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?  Wait-- you have my wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And your gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think I could have them back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see.  You could come on by my dad's place, drop 'em off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  I'll just leave 'em with the S.W.A.T. guy answers the door. Foley stops flipping through the magazine, stares at what he's been looking for: an ad for Defiance perfume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a guy here on the task force right now.  Maybe I should put him on the phone, let you two work it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're having too much fun. She doesn't know what to say to that.  Foley smells the ad. INSIDE THE HOUSE MARSHALL ...She fixes him pork chops and rice, the next thing you know they're making love on the sofa.  She says he was very gentle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spoke to her.  The guy told her he missed his little girl and she felt sorry for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how you score now? ON THE PATIO: Karen looks inside at her father talking with Ray Nicolet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad's retired.  He was a Private Investigator.  Forty years.  I used to work for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can just picture that, a cute girl like you following slip-and-fall and whiplash cheaters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something I've been wondering, what ever happened to your Uncle Cully?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?  You think he might tell you where I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless you wanna tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.  He did twenty-seven years before he came out and died not too long after in Charity Hospital, I think trying to make up for all the good times he'd missed. (then) That's not gonna be me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One last score, that the idea?  Move to some island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm partial to mountains myself.  But if you like islands, we'll make it an island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta you mean we'll make it an island?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought maybe you and me could-- Buddy opens the door, sticks his head out, startles Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you talking to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that Buddy? Foley's caught off guard, hangs up the phone.  He looks at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better come see this. INT. MARSHALL'S CONDO - DAY As Karen stands on the balcony another moment, then hangs up, opens the sliding door and walks back into the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman also said he stole her husband's gun, a twenty-two pistol, and some of his clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the woman's married.  She goes to bed with this prison escapee because he misses his little girl and then tells the world about it.  But you don't reveal her name, you protect her.  It sounds like you're saying it's okay as long as her husband doesn't find out about it.  Like the guy who cheats on his wife, saying what she doesn't know won't hurt her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad. He looks over at her now.  Gives her an innocent look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? INT. BUDDY'S APARTMENT - DAY As Foley and Buddy watch a news report on the earlier events at the hobo camp.  We catch a glimpse of RAY NICOLET, GUN IN HIS WAISTBAND, STICKING HIS CHEST OUT FOR THE CAMERA. Foley shakes his head as they show a shot of Lulu's body covered with a sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chino's gonna wanna talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's running for his life, he doesn't give a shit about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gotta know by now that I gave him up back at Glades.  He does, he's gonna try to find me.  Maybe go see Adele, see what she knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows where she lives? Foley doesn't answer.  Buddy mutes the set.  Turns to Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were talking one time, drinking rum.  I may've mentioned Adele, how she worked for a magician.  Chino got interested.  He's like, Yeah?  How does he saw the woman in half?  He wanted to meet her.  Or get a look at her if she ever came to visit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So call her up.  Tell her don't talk to any Cubans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her phone's probably tapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you know they're gonna have some people watching the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. EXT. MARSHALL SISCO'S BOAT - DAY Karen stands there with her car keys and purse as Marshall paints the trim on the boat.

INT. RIPLEY'S HOUSE - THE FOYER - SAME Foley enters and we hear the maid scream.  Foley starts up the stairs. INT. RIPLEY'S STUDY Maurice and White Boy Bob both have their guns to Ripley's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Midge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about her.  Tell me where the money's at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foley's got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the fuck is Foley? INT. UPSTAIRS HALL - SAME Foley comes up the stairs, heads for Ripley's bedroom.  The door is closed now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Midge? He steps to one side, is about to reach for the knob when suddenly the DOOR IS BLASTED OFF ITS HINGES. INT. KITCHEN (DOWNSTAIRS) - SAME TIME Karen comes through the door, hears the gunshot, stops cold. INT. HALLWAY (UPSTAIRS) - SAME As Foley steps into the doorway and we see Kenneth and the maid bare, both sitting up in bed, Kenneth racking the shotgun, the maid turning away from him, gathering the covers that hang off her side of the bed... ...and coming around to throw them like a net at Kenneth as the shotgun goes off and the covers catch fire as Foley pumps one two three shots into Kenneth somewhere under there. INT. RIPLEY'S STUDY - SAME As Ripley tries to get away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Midge! Maurice grabs him by the collar, spins him around and whips him across the face with his gun.  He and White Boy Bob then both hit Ripley on the head until he goes down and stays down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take the front stairs, I'll take the back. INT. RIPLEY'S BEDROOM - SAME As the maid jumps up and drags the burning covers from the bed and sees Kenneth now, the bullet holes in his chest, staring blankly back at him.  She then looks at Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Dick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Downstairs. (then) But wait here.  There's two more. INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - SAME As Foley starts out of the room and immediately hears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it, asshole! Foley sees White Boy Bob at the bottom of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop the gun. Nowhere to go, Foley has to comply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now stay right there.  Don't move. White Boy Bob starts to jog up the stairs two at a time, all the while keeping his eyes fixed on Foley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maurice!  I got Foley! INT. RIPLEY'S BACK STAIRCASE - SAME As Maurice starts up the backstairs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maurice!  Up here! ...and a moment later, Karen comes out of the kitchen into the downstairs hallway -- just missing each other. INT. STAIRCASE - SAME As White Boy Bob gets maybe half way up when he catches a toe on one of the risers and pitches forward.  Stupidly, he tries to break his fall with the elbow of his gun hand and ends up jamming his chin down onto the muzzle of his gun which, unfortunately for him, goes off, firing a bullet through his head and killing him instantly. To say the least, Foley is stunned by this freak accident.  He stands there looking at the dead bulk on the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You learn from doing. Foley bends down to pick up his gun and we see MAURICE COMING UP THE BACK STAIRCASE, his gun raised, and now firing away... Foley is forced to jump back behind a pillar as Maurice keeps firing at him, shots ricocheting off the pillar, the railing, the wall... INT. DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY - SAME As Karen hugs the wall at the sound of gunshots, sees Ripley lying on the floor of the study... INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - SAME As we hear CLICK as the breech opens on Maurice's now empty .45 And now Foley steps out from behind the pillar and calmly bends down, picks up his gun, Maurice still walking forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, you don't use a gun, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not until recently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nervous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This kind of setup, you don't have any idea what the fuck you're doing -- do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right.  So why take a chance-- Foley pulls the trigger.  CLICK.  Maurice hesitates, surprised that Foley would pull the trigger, then the two of them at the same time rush each other, begin a messy mano a mano , now using their spent guns as bludgeons. INT. RIPLEY'S STUDY - SAME As Karen carefully comes into the room, Ripley lets out a low GROAN.  She's bending down to check him when HER PHONE RINGS. INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - SAME As Foley and Maurice grapple on the floor near the head of the stairs. INT. STUDY - SAME As Karen answers her phone, checks Ripley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're a few minutes away.  Just sit tight, stay outta the house till we get there, understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh-kay... INT. UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - SAME As Foley finally shoves Maurice down the stairs.  Maurice rolls down a few steps, right over White Boy Bob, as... Foley gets up, runs back to the bedroom. INT. RIPLEY'S BEDROOM - SAME As Foley enters, goes straight to Kenneth's body, begins searching for the shotgun (lifting the covers, turning over the body, etc) with no success...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit... INT. STAIRWELL - SAME As Maurice attempts to prise the gun out from under the dead bulk of White Boy Bob. INT. RIPLEY'S BEDROOM - SAME As Foley, exasperated, stands back up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This what you want? Foley looks to where Midge stands -- now back in her bathrobe, but more importantly, clutching the shotgun.  Foley crosses and takes it from her, begins to stride out of the room, when -- MIDGE (CONT'D) It's empty. Foley just looks at her. INT. STAIRWELL - SAME As Maurice finally rolls White Boy Bob over, grabs the gun... INT. RIPLEY'S BEDROOM - SAME As Foley sticks his hand in Kenneth's coveralls, comes out with a shell, loads the gun, snaps it shut... INT. STAIRWELL - SAME As Maurice cocks the pistol, takes a step up the stairs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maurice-- Maurice spins around, points his gun down at Karen, now standing in the foyer, her own gun pointing up at him... EXT. HOUSE - SAME TIME As Raymond Cruz and several green-and-whites arrive... INT. RIPLEY'S BEDROOM - SAME As Jack, about to exit, stops cold as he HEARS TWO GUNSHOTS, then a BODY FALL. He stands still.  Not sure who was just shot.  After a long moment, we then hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack? He sees Midge looking at him, closes his eyes, sags against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're up there. INT. FOYER - SAME As Foley steps into the hallway, his ski mask now pulled down over his face.  He holds Kenneth's shotgun in one hand and his pistol in another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jack -- don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretend I'm somebody else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'd shoot you? Foley brings up the pistol and the shotgun.  AND NOW WE HEAR THE SIRENS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't, one of those guys will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you now, a desperado?  Put the guns down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I'm not going back. He raises the guns hip-high and we hear sounds behind Karen, but she's quick to raise her hand, though she doesn't turn or look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do this.  Please. They stand there staring at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more time outs. He raises the guns.  She sadly shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You win, Jack. She fires and he falls to the staircase, dropping the guns, grabbing hold of his right thigh.  And now Cruz and several other cops enter... Karen motions them to stop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karen, I told you not to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, I know him --okay? She goes up the staircase to where Foley is lying and gently lifts the ski mask and looks at his sad eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Jack, but I can't shoot you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just did, for Christ sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I mean. She glances about, makes sure no one can hear, then leans closer to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish things were different.  I'm sorry, Jack. Foley looks like he's in pain.  He watches as she walks back down the stairs.  As a couple of uniform cops rush past her and pick up Foley, a shaky Ripley staggers into the foyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard! She comes running down the stairs into his arms.  They embrace. He looks at Foley over her shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Jack... (but then) What'd you do with my diamonds? Foley just looks at him. EXT. BUSY STREET - NIGHT As Buddy pulls the van into an alley.  He jumps out, jogs back to the street and hails a cab... INT. CAB - SAME Buddy suddenly gets in, bangs on the bulletproof glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The airport. The cab pulls away.  Buddy glances up front, then pulls the Ziploc bag from his coat and holds it up.  There's a bit of water in along with the diamonds.  A tiny fish swims in the water.  Something about this makes Buddy smile as we...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DOOR IS BLASTED OFF ITS HINGES
MAURICE COMING UP THE BACK STAIRCASE,
AND NOW WE HEAR THE SIRENS
